tasks.title: Setup Next.js Project with Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui
tasks.description: Initialize a new Next.js project with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and shadcn/ui components to create the foundation for the Task Execution Monitor application.
tasks.details:
1. Create a new Next.js project with TypeScript:
```bash
npx create-next-app@latest task-execution-monitor --typescript
cd task-execution-monitor
```

2. Install and configure Tailwind CSS:
```bash
npm install -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer
npx tailwindcss init -p
```

3. Configure Tailwind CSS in `tailwind.config.js`:
```javascript
module.exports = {
  content: [
    './pages/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}',
    './components/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}',
    './app/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}',
  ],
  theme: {
    extend: {},
  },
  plugins: [],
}
```

4. Add Tailwind directives to `./styles/globals.css`:
```css
@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;
```

5. Install and initialize shadcn/ui (latest version):
```bash
npm install @shadcn/ui
npx shadcn-ui@latest init
```

6. Add required shadcn/ui components:
```bash
npx shadcn-ui@latest add button
npx shadcn-ui@latest add input
npx shadcn-ui@latest add badge
npx shadcn-ui@latest add card
npx shadcn-ui@latest add select
npx shadcn-ui@latest add progress
```

7. Install additional dependencies:
```bash
npm install formidable@3.5.1 lucide-react@0.400.0 class-variance-authority@0.7.0 clsx@2.0.0 tailwind-merge@2.0.0
```

8. Create basic project structure:
```
/components
  /ui (shadcn components)
  Header.tsx
  TaskMonitor.tsx
  TaskPanel.tsx
  NavigationSidebar.tsx
/pages
  index.tsx
  _app.tsx
  /api
    tasks.ts
    upload.ts
/public
/styles
  globals.css
/types
  index.ts
/uploads (create this directory for file storage)
```

tasks.title: Add Documentation and Deployment Instructions
tasks.description: Create comprehensive documentation for the application, including setup, usage, and deployment instructions.
tasks.details:
Create a detailed README.md file with the following sections:

```markdown
# Task Execution Monitor

A real-time task monitoring interface for tracking individual task execution with deep-dive capabilities, live logging, and performance metrics.

## Features

- **File-Based Task Monitoring**: Upload and monitor JSON task files
- **Context Switching**: Navigate between different task contexts
- **Task Navigation**: Easily navigate between tasks with previous/next buttons and dropdown selection
- **Task Details**: View comprehensive task information including description, implementation details, and test strategy
- **Dependency Tracking**: See task dependencies and dependents
- **Progress Tracking**: Monitor task progress with visual indicators
- **Search Functionality**: Find tasks by title or description
- **Auto-Refresh**: Automatically refresh task data every 5 seconds

## Getting Started

### Prerequisites

- Node.js 18.x or later
- npm or yarn

### Installation

1. Clone the repository:
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/yourusername/task-execution-monitor.git
   cd task-execution-monitor
   ```

2. Install dependencies:
   ```bash
   npm install
   # or
   yarn install
   ```

3. Create the uploads directory:
   ```bash
   mkdir -p uploads
   ```

4. Start the development server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   # or
   yarn dev
   ```

5. Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your browser

## Usage

### Uploading Task Data

1. Click the "Select File" button in the header
2. Choose a JSON file with the appropriate structure (see [Data Format](#data-format))
3. The file will be uploaded and parsed, and the tasks will be displayed

### Navigating Tasks

- Use the previous/next buttons to navigate sequentially through tasks
- Use the task dropdown to jump directly to a specific task
- Click on dependencies or dependents in the sidebar to navigate to those tasks

### Searching Tasks

- Use the search box to filter tasks by title or description
- Results will update as you type

### Auto-Refresh

- Toggle the "Auto 5s" button to enable/disable automatic refreshing
- When enabled, the application will check for changes to the task file every 5 seconds

## Data Format

The application expects JSON files with the following structure:

```json
{
  "contextName": {
    "tasks": [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "title": "Task Title",
        "description": "Task description",
        "details": "Implementation details",
        "testStrategy": "Test strategy",
        "status": "pending|in-progress|done|cancelled",
        "priority": "high|medium|low",
        "dependencies": [2, 3],
        "progress": 75,
        "subtasks": [
          {
            "id": 1,
            "title": "Subtask Title",
            "description": "Subtask description",
            "details": "Implementation details",
            "testStrategy": "Test strategy",
            "status": "pending|in-progress|done|cancelled",
            "dependencies": [],
            "parentTaskId": 1
          }
        ]
      }
    ],
    "metadata": {
      "created": "2023-11-01T10:00:00.000Z",
      "updated": "2023-11-05T15:30:00.000Z",
      "description": "Context description"
    }
  }
}
```

- Multiple contexts can be defined (e.g., "master", "coverage")
- Each context contains a list of tasks and metadata
- Tasks can have subtasks for hierarchical organization
- Progress can be specified explicitly or calculated from subtask completion

## Deployment

### Deploying to Vercel

1. Push your code to a GitHub repository
2. Import the repository in Vercel
3. Configure the build settings:
   - Build Command: `npm run build`
   - Output Directory: `.next`
4. Deploy

### Deploying to Netlify

1. Push your code to a GitHub repository
2. Import the repository in Netlify
3. Configure the build settings:
   - Build Command: `npm run build`
   - Publish Directory: `.next`
4. Add the following redirect rule to `netlify.toml`:
   ```toml
   [[redirects]]
     from = "/*"
     to = "/index.html"
     status = 200
   ```
5. Deploy

### Docker Deployment

1. Create a Dockerfile:
   ```dockerfile
   FROM node:18-alpine
   WORKDIR /app
   COPY package*.json ./
   RUN npm install
   COPY . .
   RUN npm run build
   EXPOSE 3000
   CMD ["npm", "start"]
   ```

2. Build and run the Docker image:
   ```bash
   docker build -t task-execution-monitor .
   docker run -p 3000:3000 task-execution-monitor
   ```

## Contributing

Contributions are welcome! Please feel free to submit a Pull Request.

## License

This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the LICENSE file for details.
```

4. Data format specifications
5. Deployment instructions for various platforms
6. Contributing guidelines and license information
